slides.title: Risk Assessment
slides.content:
# Identifying and Assessing Risk

## Risk Matrix

| | Low Impact | High Impact |
|---|------------|-------------|
| High Probability | Medium | High |
| Low Probability | Low | Medium |

## Risk Assessment Process

```
1. Identify risks
2. Analyze likelihood
3. Analyze impact
4. Prioritize
5. Develop response
```

## Risk Appetite vs Tolerance

| Concept | Definition |
|---------|------------|
| Appetite | Level willing to accept |
| Tolerance | Acceptable variation |

slides.title: ERM Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Risk appetite is the level of risk an organization is?

slides.title: Risk Response
slides.content:
# Risk Treatment Options

## Response Strategies

| Strategy | Action |
|----------|--------|
| Avoid | Eliminate activity |
| Reduce | Controls, mitigation |
| Transfer | Insurance, outsource |
| Accept | Retain within tolerance |

## Cost-Benefit

```
Cost of control vs Risk reduction

Implement if benefit > cost
```

## Residual Risk

```
Inherent Risk - Control Effectiveness
= Residual Risk

Must be within tolerance
```

slides.title: Currency Risk
slides.content:
# Foreign Exchange Risk

## Exposure Types

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Transaction | Specific deals |
| Translation | Consolidation |
| Economic | Competitive position |

## Transaction Exposure

```
Risk from:
- Foreign receivables
- Foreign payables
- Contractual cash flows
```

## Natural Hedging

- Match revenues and costs
- Diversify across currencies
- Lead and lag payments

slides.title: Currency Hedging
slides.content:
# Hedging Instruments

## Forward Contracts

```
Lock in exchange rate for future date
Customized, OTC
```

## Currency Futures

```
Standardized contracts
Exchange-traded
Margin requirements
```

## Currency Options

```
Right but not obligation
Call: right to buy
Put: right to sell
Premium cost
```

## Money Market Hedge

```
Borrow/invest in foreign currency
to match exposure
```

slides.title: Currency Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: A forward contract does what to the exchange rate?

slides.title: Interest Rate Risk
slides.content:
# Managing Interest Rates

## Exposure

| Position | Risk |
|----------|------|
| Floating debt | Rates rise |
| Fixed investments | Rates rise |
| Fixed debt | Rates fall |

## Duration

```
Measure of interest rate sensitivity

Higher duration = More sensitive
```

## Gap Analysis

```
Rate-sensitive assets - Rate-sensitive liabilities
= Gap

Positive gap: Benefits from rising rates
```

slides.title: Interest Rate Hedging
slides.content:
# Interest Rate Instruments

## Interest Rate Swaps

```
Exchange fixed for floating payments
(or vice versa)
```

## Caps, Floors, Collars

| Instrument | Protection |
|------------|------------|
| Cap | Maximum rate |
| Floor | Minimum rate |
| Collar | Both cap and floor |

## Forward Rate Agreements

```
Lock in rate for future period
Cash settlement
```
